comments:
The Eclipse RCP application I'm working on starts find using a standard launcher configuration.  Recently I updated our feature to include all of the plugins needed by our project (Eclipse rcp plugins included) and changed our product to be feature based.  I then tried starting the app using the Launch Product link in the product editor.  This fails with an IllegalStateException:

java.lang.IllegalStateException: Unable to acquire application service.
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.internal.adaptor.EclipseAppLauncher.start(EclipseAppLauncher.java:65)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:376)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:169)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:585)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.invokeFramework(Main.java:336)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:280)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:977)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:952)

I have managed to track this problem down to the fact that the dynamically generated config.ini file is somehow invalid.  Attached are the bad dynamically generated config.ini file and one that works.  I tried deleting the dynamically generated config.ini file and letting Eclipse regenerate it.  The problem still exists however.

Created an attachment (id=39445)
Valid config.ini file.

Existing config.ini which will allow the application to launch.
Seems like a good candidate for Product Editor Week.

Can you try the same scenario with 3.3M6?  We have changed the way config.ini's get generated with respect to the launcher.  If not, is there any simple test case that you might be able to provide that would produce the same error?

The valid config.ini does not seem to be very custom, but have you tried specifying it in the product configuration?  I went through and confirmed a launch will use the config.ini specified in a product configuration as a template for a launch config.
Hi Scott, when you get a chance can you try your scenario again on one of the latest 3.3 milestones?  I think we might have this fixed.
